intro: Codonanthopsis aggregata, commonly known as the clustered moss rose, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces flowers in a variety of colors, including red, pink, and white, often blooming in late summer. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and rockeries as a decorative plant.
